15:29 <sburjan> Hello. I see that in our 5.2RC1 we have 2 versions of jdom jar:  jdom2-2.0.5.jar and jdom-1.1.3.jar. Is this intended/known/normal ?  
15:33 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:34 <vmassol> has quit  
15:39 <tmortagne> sburjan: those are completely different  
15:39 <tmortagne> we have two version of commons-lang too ;)  
15:40 <sburjan> ok  
15:40 <tmortagne> as you can see they don't have the same id  
15:54 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:54 <Denis> has quit

16:40 <evalica> has quit  
16:40 <polx> has quit  
16:45 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:46 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <D-Spair> Hey all. I'm having a rights issue in 5.1... My blog space is set to allow XWikiAllGroup to view/comment... The XWiki global rights are set to allow XWikiAllGroup view/comment, and I have turned off the "Prevent unregistered users from viewing pages, regardless of the page or space rights" option. Still, unauthenticated users get a login page trying to view the blog... Thoughts?  
16:50 <tmortagne> D-Spair: XWikiAllGroup groups means the users of the wiki so when you give view rights to this group to implicitly remove that right to anyone else  
16:50 <tmortagne> you need to give view right to unauthenticated users in your blog space  
16:50 <D-Spair> Oh? So I should "clear" those checkboxes and it should resolve it?  
16:51 <D-Spair> How do I give view/comment rights to unregistered users?  
16:51 <tmortagne> D-Spair: basically when you set an right you kill inheritance  
16:52 <tmortagne> you might want to look at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Access+Rights  
16:53 <D-Spair> Thanks for the assistance... It might be more intuitive to create a virtual "Unauthenticated Users" group which you could use to explicitly assign rights...  
16:54 <tmortagne> D-Spair: you have one  
16:54 <tmortagne> it's in users  
16:54 <tmortagne> not groups  
16:54 <tmortagne> that's why I said "you need to give view right to unauthenticated users in your blog space" ;)  
16:54 <D-Spair> Now I see it!  
16:54 <D-Spair> Thank you!  
16:56 <tmortagne> np it might be easier if that entity was in groups instead of users I don't know
